text: {| class=wikitable align=right width=160 |+ Orthographic projections A5 Coxeter plane |- align=center |160px 5-simplex |} In 5-dimensional geometry, there are 19 uniform polytopes with A5 symmetry. There is one self-dual regular form, the 5-simplex with 6 vertices. Each can be visualized as symmetric orthographic projections in Coxeter planes of the A5 Coxeter group, and other subgroups. == Graphs == Symmetric orthographic projections of these 19 polytopes can be made in the A5, A4, A3, A2 Coxeter planes. Ak graphs have [k+1] symmetry. For even k and symmetrically nodea_1ed- diagrams, symmetry doubles to [2(k+1)]. These 19 polytopes are each shown in these 4 symmetry planes, with vertices and edges drawn, and vertices colored by the number of overlapping vertices in each projective position. {|
